title: Shooting Investigation
content:
News Release
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Shooting Investigation
(October 02, 2016) On October 01, 2016 at about 9:30 pm, Kerrville Police officers responded to a shooting that had just occurred at the intersection of W. Schreiner St. and Paschal St. While officers were en route to the scene, an officer was flagged down by the victim’s father at the intersection of Schreiner St. and Sidney Baker. The victim’s father stated to police that his seven year old daughter had been shot.
The victim’s father was arguing with another male at the intersection of W. Schreiner St and Paschal St. when other unknown subjects fired several rounds towards the victim’s vehicle. The victim’s father realized that she was bleeding and drove towards the Kerrville Police Department.
The seven year old victim was struck on the head and was flown to University Trauma Center in San Antonio. The victim is currently in critical condition.
The suspects are still at large and this incident is currently being investigated by the Kerrville Police Department’s Criminal Investigations Unit (C.I.U.).
The Kerrville Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying the suspects. If anyone has any information on this investigation or knows the identity and location of the suspects, they are requested to call C.I.U. at (830) 257-8181 or Kerr County Crime Stoppers (830) 896-8477 (TIPS).
